page.title: 17FARMING..ROTATION
page.content: The farm is a mixed farm which this year grows barley and kale and breeds cattle. The barley, a very profitable crop, is sold for Â£115 per tonne to a malting company who then process for use in whisky production. The kale is used for animal fodder. Mr.Ostler has 54 cattle and 175 ewes. By the autumn he will have up to 2000 lambs which will be fattened ready for market. A typical crop rotation in one field would be: 1st year: grass 2nd year: barley 3rd year: wheat 4th year: wheat 5th year: kale 6th year: barley 7th year: barley In the future Mr.Ostler hopes to cut down on barley and grow peas/flax/OSR.
